channel.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
channel.description:
So I was thinking about Episode 3 ... The main feature will be the Borealis, or goal if you will, and what kind of lab was it again that produced this magnificent vessel? That's right Portals own Apperture Science. I think Portal 2 is partially to get the players closer to the Borealis by playing Portal 2, to take this new fact and use it in Episode 3.
Yeah I know that Portal 2 is many hundred years in the future ... But still, don't you think Portal 2 is gonna have anything to do about the Episode 3 story plot?

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
It’s still connected to the Half-Life universe, they’re just not going to elaborate on that connection other than possibly minor references as in the first Portal.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
I remember reading somewhere that Portal 2 will for sure not be connected to the Half-Life universe whatsoever, other than the fact that you are in the same complex that you were in in the original Portal. Portal 2 is going to be its own standalone game with not attachments, however slight, to EP3.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
lambda:

I have a slight feeling that Portal 2 will be before Half Life 2, i know it’s impossible because it takes place hundreds of years after Portal 1, which was about equal/a bit earlier than the Black Mesa incident, but still, “Thermal Discouragement Beam” video, at the intro(of every Portal 2 tech movie btw) is: “Aperture Science 1998”…

That doesn’t mean anything. It was probably around in the complex during the events of Portal 1 but were being used in an area Chell never got to see.

Flatline:

Yeah, the clue would be the S for Shooter. According to your logic Bomberman is an FPS because you kill things.

DiePoente:

FP -> First-Person

Actually…

Pwn’d!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: DrGonzo
item.description:
Well, we do at least know the planet hasn’t been destroyed in a few hundred years. Unless of course you aren’t actually on Earth.

Also, it could easily be called a FPS. You play it in first person and the entire premise is based around shooting a gun.

item.description:
DiePoente:

Sooooooo, it’s only a FPS if you can kill something? That’s stupid.

And the Portal gun is still a weapon, since you can use it to kill something. Even if it’s indirectly.

Yeah, the clue would be the S for Shooter. According to your logic Bomberman is an FPS because you kill things.

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
DiePoente:

And Portal is a FPS. Since you “shoot” portals

I’m really going to have to disagree with you there. I think pretty much everyone would agree that Portal is a first person puzzler. You don’t have any weapons and the only way you kill things is indirectly.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
Do you guys even read articles? It’s been said for 6 months in the GameInformer

And higgsboson,

Portal was an experimental game for Valve to see if they can make a cool puzzle game. They re-used Half-Life 2’s engine, and many elements, such as sounds, some elements for the turrets, the energy orb, etc. since they already had all that.

Isn’t it random, that it’s “exactly” what Valve said in the GameInformer? Everything but the first sentence. They hired the guys behind Narbacular Drop and made Portal, and not if they can make a cool puzzle game, they did it, to make a game with a new principle.

The Borealis exists since 2004 and wasn’t made for Portal 1, but they reused it in Episode 2, and Portal doesn’t take place on the Borealis.

And Portal is a FPS. Since you “shoot” portals

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
My theory:

Portal was an experimental game for Valve to see if they can make a cool puzzle game. They re-used Half-Life 2’s engine, and many elements, such as sounds, some elements for the turrets, the energy orb, etc. since they already had all that.

Then, for fun, they figured it would be cool to have some indications about Black Mesa in Portal and link the two universes together.

Then came the idea of the Borealis, and that Portal takes place on that ship, but no reference has been made to this in the games. In EP2, all we know is that there is the Borealis and it has to be destroyed. They have teleportation technology, and that’s it.

I doubt they would eventually link Portal and Half-Life together. They’re about different things, it would not work. Portal is a puzzle game, and Half-Life is a FPS. The link can be present for fun and for easter eggs, but I don’t think they would really let you have the portal gun in EP3, or anything like that.

Portal 2 has been announced, and there was no indication of it being related to EP3 in any way from the teasers.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
SweBlaze:

, but I think Portal 2 will still have something to do with HL2:EP3.

I wouldn’t hold my breathe on it.

Look:

Many Portal fans never played Half Life.
Many Half Life fans never played Portal.

If you have to play Portal 2 to understand some things in HL2 Episode 3, that’d be stupid, cause some people just don’t like it.

There won’t be more than 1 or 2 very little hints, I think. Moreover, AS is a underground laboratory, the things which happen outside do not affect the things inside.

Read full topic
item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: SweBlaze
item.description:
Dias:

What’s your excuse then?

I have none.

DiePoente:

It isn’t random, that Portal 2 takes place hundreds of years after the Half Life. It does it, to lose the connection to the Half Life universe.

Yeah sure I know that but maybe GLaDOS refers to earlier events that will happen in HL2:EP3.

I realize now that it was stupid to say that Portal 2 is highly connected with EP3, but I think Portal 2 will still have something to do with HL2:EP3.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: blue
item.description:
they were supposed to be deeply connected but they dropped the idea a long time ago, watch the e3 and pax interviews ffs, they answer all questions, they go pretty deep why there was connection between ep 2 and portal in the first place, there wont be the slightest mention on hl2 story in portal 2, only ester egg stuff i bet.

item.source: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3

item.title: Portal 2 just a story plot to HL2:E3
item.dc:creator: VmKid
item.description:
SweBlaze:

So I was thinking about Episode 3 … The main feature will be the Borealis, or goal if you will, and what kind of lab was it again that produced this magnificent vessel? That’s right Portals own Apperture Science. I think Portal 2 is partially to get the players closer to the Borealis by playing Portal 2, to take this new fact and use it in Episode 3.

Wow, Really? I thought that it was a DIFFERENT Aperture Science!

Yeah I know that Portal 2 is many hundred years in the future … But still, don’t you think Portal 2 is gonna have anything to do about the Episode 3 story plot?

No, no it will not. It may reveal some information about the plot to Episode 3, but it will have no bearing on the plot, 'cause, well, it takes place WELL AFTER Gordon Freeman and Alyx visit the Borealis.

Read full topic
